Detailed Description

Class Index implements a simple n-dimensional integer vector in the AMR index space. Index is used as lower and upper bounds when creating a box and also when iterating over the cells in a box. An index is essentially an integer vector but it carries along the notion of indexing into AMR's abstract index space.

See also:
hier::Box
hier::BoxIterator
hier::IntVector

Member Function Documentation

Index& SAMRAI::hier::Index::operator= ( const Index &  rhs  )  [inline]

The assignment operator sets the index equal to the argument.

An assignment to an uninitialized Index is allowed but assigning from an uninitialized Index will result in an assert.

Precondition:
getDim() == rhs.getDim()

Reimplemented from SAMRAI::hier::IntVector.

Reimplemented in SAMRAI::pdat::CellIndex, SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex, SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex, SAMRAI::pdat::NodeIndex, and SAMRAI::pdat::SideIndex.

References TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2.

Referenced by operator=().

Index& SAMRAI::hier::Index::coarsen ( const IntVector &  ratio  )  [inline]

Coarsen the Index by a given ratio.

For positive indices, this is the same as dividing by the ratio.

Precondition:
getDim() == ratio.getDim()
